alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 5:51PM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Navarro River at Navarro affecting Mendocino County. For the Navarro River...including Navarro...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navarro River at Navarro. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Water will flow over the south bank of the river approximately 1 mile east of Highway 1, and begins to flood property in this area including six homes. Expect closure of Highway 128. Motorists should use alternate routes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM PST Saturday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 17.7 feet this evening. It will then rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 29.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 17.1 feet Monday morning. It will then rise above flood stage again Monday afternoon to 25.2 feet late Monday evening. It will fall below flood stage again early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.5 feet on 02/07/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautions at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 600 AM PST.
